Are you sure about this? There is a method called
assertSame() that checks if the objects have the same reference
ie they are the same object.

The assertEquals() uses the .equals() method to do the actual
comparing. That means that it tries to do exp.equals(actual)
and asserts if it is not true. (or the other way around)
So in order to compare 2 objects deep, you need to implement
the equals() method and do the comparing by yourself. 

Or am I totally off track??

//erik


> Hi,
> I would like to deep compare 2 objects (expectedResult and 
> actualResult)
> using JUnit.
> 
> JUnit provides an interface called assertEquals(Object o1, Object
o2) 
> which compares 2 obects by reference and does not perform a deep 
> comparison.
> 
> Since the expectedResult and actualResult will never have the same
> reference, does anyone have any idea on how to perform a deep 
> comparison comparing the values of 2 objects) ?
> 
> Cheers
> Kartik
